intro: Dinebra curtipendula, commonly known as the slender false foxglove, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Dinebra curtipendula is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an indicator species for early successional habitats.
